intro: Gypsocallis articularis, commonly known as the articular gypsocallis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the southern United States, particularly Texas, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It is often found in rocky soils and can tolerate drought conditions. The genus Gypsocallis is characterized by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
